animals.wild_ancestor: Gayal (Bos frontalis) with significant introgression from other Bos species
animals.status: Somewhat common in captivity, threatened in the wild

animals.wild_ancestor: Common mallard (Anas platyrhynchos platyrhynchos)
animals.status: Common in captivity, but more abundant in the wild

animals.wild_ancestor: Wild water buffalo (Bubalus arnee)
animals.physical_changes: Mainly unchanged from the wild animal
animals.status: Common in captivity, endangered in the wild, feral populations common in parts of Australia and South America

animals.wild_ancestor: Unknown
animals.status: Moderately common in captivity, small feral population in original range, significant feral population in Australia, truly wild dromedaries may be extinct

animals.wild_ancestor: Various subspecies of the wild honey bee
animals.physical_changes: Some physical and behavioral changes, actual domestication status is still a point of contention
animals.status: Very common in captivity, feral populations common, extent of status in the wild unclear

animals.wild_ancestor: Extinct unknown population of the wild horse (Equus ferus), possibly the tarpan or European wild horse (E. f. ferus)
animals.physical_changes: Tame, some physical changes, mainly in colouration
animals.status: Common in captivity, very rare in the wild, feral populations common

animals.wild_ancestor: Banteng (Bos javanicus)
animals.status: Common in captivity, endangered in the wild

animals.wild_ancestor: Wild silkmoth (Bombyx mandarina)
animals.physical_changes: Tame/held in captivity, some physical changes
animals.status: Fairly common in captivity, extent of status in the wild unclear

animals.wild_ancestor: Ailanthus silkmoth (Samia cynthia) and wild eri silkmoth (Samia canningi)
animals.physical_changes: Tame/held in captivity, some physical changes

animals.wild_ancestor: Rock dove (Columba livia)
animals.physical_changes: Artificially selected and bred into many varieties including meat breeds, racing/messenger breeds and fancy plumage breeds
animals.status: Relatively common in captivity, very common in the wild, feral populations extremely abundant

animals.animal: Domestic goose and domestic swan goose (Anser anser domesticus and Anser cygnoides domesticus)
animals.wild_ancestor: Greylag goose (Anser anser) and swan goose (A. cygnoides)
animals.domestication_date: 3000 BCE for A. anser, date uncertain for A. cygnoides
animals.status: Common in the wild and in captivity

animals.wild_ancestor: Extinct Pleistocene population of the grey wolf (Canis lupus ssp.)
animals.origin: China, Europe, different places in Asia
animals.domestication_changes: Tame (with exceptions), significant physical changes, probably significant behavioral changes
animals.current_status: Domestic and feral dogs both very common, ancestor or nearest wild relative less common, but not rare

animals.wild_ancestor: Possibly the Armenian mouflon (Ovis gmelini gmelini)
animals.current_status: Common in captivity, threatened in the wild

animals.wild_ancestor: Anatolian boar (Sus scrofa libycus), Northern Chinese boar (Sus scrofa moupinensis)
animals.current_status: Common in the wild, much more common in captivity, feral populations common in some areas

animals.wild_ancestor: Eurasian aurochs (Bos primigenius primigenius)
animals.current_status: Very common in captivity, wild relatives extinct, feral populations fairly common

animals.wild_ancestor: Bezoar ibex (Capra aegagrus aegagrus)
animals.current_status: Common in captivity, threatened in the wild, feral populations common

animals.wild_ancestor: Indian aurochs (Bos primigenius namadicus)
animals.current_status: Common in captivity, wild relatives extinct

animals.wild_ancestor: Common North African wildcat (Felis lybica lybica)
animals.current_status: Very abundant in captivity; true wildcat species less abundant, though not rare, feral populations very common

animals.wild_ancestor: Bangladesh red junglefowl (Gallus gallus murghi) with some contribution from the grey junglefowl (Gallus sonneratii)
animals.domestication_changes: Some physical changes, considerable reproductive changes
animals.current_status: Very common in the wild and in captivity

animals.wild_ancestor: Montane guinea pig (Cavia tschudii)
animals.current_status: Somewhat common in the wild and in captivity

animals.wild_ancestor: African wild ass (Equus africanus), including subspecies Nubian (E. a. africanus) and Somali wild ass (E. a. somaliensis)
animals.current_status: Somewhat common in captivity and as feral populations, wild relatives critically endangered
